item.title: Magic typing with shortcuts on Linux
item.description: Ever find yourself typing more characters than is necessary when using some annoying application or website? Here’s a quick hack around that. Intro: There’s a magic program called xdotool written by Jordan Sissel that solves this problem. I’ve known about his excellent work for years, but only today did I learn he also wrote xdotool. It’s named as such because it tells the X server to do something for you.
